file_content.text: You have done well.
I am Jorr-Da. I observe potentials.
The trials are perilous. Few survive.
I tried to think like a Mystic.
I did my best.
Outsider logic. A Mystic's response.
The power of the Mystics shouldn't come easily.
As it should be.
They realize their importance.
You play pretty hard with the Mystics' lives.
That's pretty harsh.
A Mystic must see clearly.
I'm not sure I could repeat that performance.
I hope I passed.
There is no need.
What are the trials supposed to teach us?
Is it worth it?
The first trial weighs a Mystic's words. The second, their focus.
The third, a sad truth. A Mystic must take to give.
You should have died.
Seers, healers, guides. No trial can prepare them.
One much like a Mystic now protects the Voss. The trials end here.
I'm honored to have completed the trials.
Thanks for the opportunity.
One lesson remains.
Some Mystics see. Others heal.
Even an outsider can learn.
The trials have given you insight. A vision.
I thought only Mystics could have visions.
Is that possible?
A Mystic will see. The vision is yours.
A vision of the Voss? Or the Republic?
What will I see?
We see what we are meant to.
These ancient tablets guide a Mystic's thoughts.
Meditate. Focus. You will find what you seek.
[You have seen your vision. The tablet is silent.]
Clear your mind. Focus.
I still believe in Master Tol Braga's mission. I will lead you to the light side.
You will be redeemed.
That path ends only with destruction.
This vision proves we'll meet again. I look forward to that conversation.
We'll see about that.
You hasten to embrace your extinction.
You're wrong about me. I have the will and the power to finish you.
I will. [Kill the Emperor.]
Fate has sent me a challenge. I had hoped for more time, but all things must adapt or die.
You didn't mention the Emperor or his Children. Is there another threat?
What's wrong, Master?
You will see what blinded me.
I'll soon have an entire army at my back. Whatever you face, you won't be alone.
I won't let you die.
The greatest challenges are those we set ourselves.
That's an unusually bleak outlook for you, Master.
How depressing.
When we step into the abyss, we cannot step back.
Someone has to keep the Empire from enslaving the entire galaxy.
I'm defending freedom.
The galaxy is already enslaved--but I will free it soon enough.
Do you actually expect me to join up with you?
Are you trying to recruit me?
I expect you to see reason.
When I find you, Rakton, it won't be to talk.
Spare me the rant.
Ignoring the truth will not change it.
Seriously? The Voidwolf's right-hand man is calling me a traitor?
You're crazy.
I know who my enemies are. Do you?
What does that mean?
Wouldn't hurt you to think about it.
I'm going to ruin your game on Voss first.
You're going down, Rogun.
Why? Who does that serve?
The vision has ended. There is no more.
Can I do anything to change what I saw?
Will that definitely happen?
Nothing can stop what comes.
I need to know what my vision meant.
I don't understand.
A Mystic can only see.
There has to be more than that.
That didn't tell me anything!
Visions are often incomplete.
You are part of a vision. You are now worthy to defend the Voss.
Edan-Je speaks for the commandos. Find him in Gorma-Koss.
Your Republic asks for our aid. They are not worthy.
You have walked a Mystic's path. Help Ambassador Jannik understand.
Our visions are certain. We choose our response.
The trials have ended. Farewell, outsider.
[Nothing happens.]
Maybe you'll kill me... but not before I show the galaxy that you're a traitor!
You harness immense power--but you lack the purity of will to direct it.
I will not be contained. I cannot be redeemed. Death is all that remains, and you will not kill me.
If I must die, everything dies with me.
Can you not see your corrupt and weak-minded leaders are dragging you down?
Your Republic will fall--by the hands of the Empire or by the weight of its own decadence. The end is inevitable. Why prolong the suffering?
They're not me.
Where do I go from here?
I don't even get a trophy?
Show me how.
